intro: Mokof, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing herb, often with a rosette of leaves at the base. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow, making it a popular ornamental plant. Mokof prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
